channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: DHS Breach: 'CitrixBleed 2.0' Zero-Day Exposes FEMA & CBP Employee Data
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Citrix NetScaler Gateway, dubbed 'CitrixBleed 2.0' (CVE-2025-5777), was exploited to breach the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The attack, which began in June 2025, compromised the personal and employment data of staff at the Federal Emergency Management A...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT Salt Typhoon Targets European Telecom with SNAPPYBEE Backdoor
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Salt Typhoon has been observed targeting a European telecommunications firm by exploiting a known Citrix NetScaler vulnerability for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deployed a backdoor known as SNAPPYBEE (or Deed RAT) using DLL side-loading techniqu...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Russian APT COLDRIVER Rapidly Deploys New NOROBOT Malware After Public Disclosure
item.description:
The Russian state-sponsored threat group COLDRIVER, also known as Star Blizzard and UNC4057, has demonstrated remarkable operational agility by deploying new malware families just five days after its LOSTKEYS malware was publicly disclosed in May 2025. According to Google's Threat Intelligence Group...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded globa...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Cavalry Werewolf' APT Targets Russian Critical Infrastructure with Custom Malware
item.description:
The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as Cavalry Werewolf (also tracked as YoroTrooper and Silent Lynx) conducted a targeted cyberattack campaign against Russia's public sector and critical industries between May and August 2025. The group leveraged spear-phishing emails to deliver custom...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Anubis Ransomware Hits Australian Engineering Firm Aussie Fluid Power
item.description:
The Australian industrial engineering company, Aussie Fluid Power, has confirmed it was hit by a ransomware attack claimed by the emerging 'Anubis' ransomware group. The incident, which has impacted company operations and stakeholder data, aligns with warnings from the Australian Cyber Security Cent...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "SIMCARTEL" CaaS Network Busted in Major European Takedown
item.description:
A coordinated international law enforcement operation codenamed "SIMCARTEL" has dismantled a massive Cybercrime-as-a-Service (CaaS) platform operating out of Latvia. The operation, involving authorities from Austria, Estonia, and Finland with support from Europol, resulted in seven arrests and the s...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Silver Fox APT Expands Reach, Targets Japan and Malaysia with New RAT
item.description:
The Chinese-nexus cybercrime group known as "Silver Fox" has expanded its targeting beyond China and Taiwan to include organizations in Japan and Malaysia. Researchers report the group is using phishing emails with malicious PDFs to distribute the HoldingHands RAT. This expansion follows previous ca...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco Zero-Day Flaw Actively Exploited to Implant Linux Rootkits on Network Switches
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Cisco IOS and IOS XE software, tracked as CVE-2025-20352, has been actively exploited in the wild to install Linux rootkits on network devices. The campaign, dubbed 'ZeroDisco' by Trend Micro, targeted Cisco 9400, 9300, and 3750G series switches. The attackers le...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →
